1.title: Perfect Being, God & Consciousness

episode of.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (TV Series 2015– )

1.plot: Yujin Nagasawa, professor of Philosophy at the University of Birmingham, tackles questions such as how the brain creates a consciousness of the cosmos.

2.title: Implications of Astrobiology: Understanding Our Unseen Reality

episode of.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (TV Series 2015– )

2.plot: Steven Dick, author of "Implications of Astrobiology: Understanding our Unseen World", discusses the search for life outside Earth and our solar system, and the meaning of a "post-biological" universe, among other topics.

3.title: Cosmic Jazz & Quantum Consciousness

episode of.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (TV Series 2015– )

3.plot: Stephon Alexander, a theoretical physicist at Dartmouth, whose work studies the interface of sub atomic particles with super clusters, tackles defining Quantum Gravity and its relation to String Theory.

4.title: Biofield Science & the Future of Healing

episode of.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (TV Series 2015– )

4.plot: Shamini Jain, a professor at UC San Diego, talks about her work in biofield healing and psychoneuro immunology. She discusses the mind/brain/body relationship, bioelectromagnetics in medicine and new developments in biofield science.

5.title: Essential Conundrums: What Is & What Matters

episode of.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (TV Series 2015– )

5.plot: Rebecca Goldstein, of the New College of Humanities in London, discusses her career as a writer, trying to embed ethical questions and philosophy into storytelling to look more closely into areas in which philosophy and science work to answer the same questions.

6.title: Is There a Connection Between Quantum Mechanics and Consciousness?

episode of.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (TV Series 2015– )

6.plot: Paavo Pylkkanen, a Finnish philosopher of mind at the University of Helsinki, discusses how modern physics affects our world view. Can you scientifically prove an observer-independent universe? What do Bohmian mechanics tell us about real life?

7.title: Revisiting Evolution of Species

episode of.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (TV Series 2015– )

7.plot: Neil Theise, Professor of Pathology and of Medicine at the Beth Israel Medical Center of Albert Einstein College of Medicine, discusses the significance of the stem cells in the human body. In light of what we are learning about stem cells, do we need to revise our picture of evolution?

8.title: Creative Cosmos

episode of.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (TV Series 2015– )

8.plot: Menas Kafatos, Professor of Computational Physics at Chapman University and author of "The Conscious Universe", engages in a wide ranging discussion of science, religion and philosophy and how they intersect and diverge.

9.title: The Knobe Effect: The World as We Are

episode of.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (TV Series 2015– )

9.plot: Joshua Knobe, a Yale Professor in experimental philosophy, asks many questions about human nature // how people become capable of evil, and if we can empirically measure "intention". Why is war thought of as a solution to, not a symptom of, of a problem?

10.title: A Beautiful Question, Part 1

episode of.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (TV Series 2015– )

10.plot: Frank Wilczek, Nobel Laureate and Professor of Physics at MIT, discusses his work in particle physics, dark matter and dark energy.

11.title: A Beautiful Question, Part 2

episode of.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (TV Series 2015– )

11.plot: Frank Wilczek, Nobel Laureate and Professor of Physics at MIT, talks about his latest book "A Beautiful Question: Finding Nature's Deep Design".

12.title: Understanding Our Unseen Reality

episode of.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (TV Series 2015– )

12.plot: Quantum Physics mathematically describes reality at the smallest scales. However, scientists argue over its interpretation and what it means.

13.title: The Non Local Universe

episode of.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (TV Series 2015– )

13.plot: A conversation with physicist Jenny Nielsen on the nature of fundamental reality, space and time and the nature of entanglement.

14.title: Non-Dual Reality

episode of.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (TV Series 2015– )

14.plot: Rupert Spira, a masterful teacher, talking with Deepak Chopra, discusses using meditation as a skill to grow closer to the fundamental reality of existence.

15.title: Consciousness Is the Way the Universe Turns Nothing Into Something

episode of.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (TV Series 2015– )

15.plot: Fred Alan Wolf, a theoretical physicist specializing in quantum physics and author, explains why he thinks consciousness may be the stuff of the universe.

16.title: The Super Human Mind

episode of.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (TV Series 2015– )

16.plot: Does a mind element exist in the fabric of space-time? What is Panpsychism? Berit Brogaard, noted philosopher and author, discusses these and other questions with Deepak Chopra.

17.title: Is Mind/Body Medicine Becoming Mainstream?

episode of.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (TV Series 2015– )

17.plot: James Gordon, MD, and Deepak Chopra MD discuss the science of healing and advances in medicine aligned with mind/body connections.

18.title: Iranian Woman - Space Hero

episode of.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (TV Series 2015– )

18.plot: Anousheh Ansari, an engineer and the first Muslim woman in space, the fourth overall self-funded space traveler, and the first self-funded woman to fly to the International Space Station, reflects on life, space travel, and being a role model for young women.

19.title: The Mind Body Code

episode of.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (TV Series 2015– )

19.plot: How do culture, context and interpretation shape our biology ? Dr. Mario Martinez, founder of the Institute of Biocognitive Psychology, discusses this with Deepak Chopra.

20.title: The Garden of Truth: The Vision and Promise of Sufism, Islam's Mystical Tradition

episode of.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (TV Series 2015– )

20.plot: Professor Nasr, who has written extensively on mystic traditions in Islam, discusses the idea that the absolute reality of all mystical traditions is one and the same.

21.title: How We Create Our Reality

episode of.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (TV Series 2015– )

21.plot: Jenny Wade, author and consultant, discusses awareness with Deepak Chopra. Consciousness expands our cognition, and as our perceptions change, our experience of the world changes.

22.title: God That Could Be Real

episode of.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (TV Series 2015– )

22.plot: According to historian and author, Nancy Abrams, the study of the Science God could be an emergent phenomenon in the 21st Century.

23.title: Solution to the Hard Problem of Consciousness

episode of.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (TV Series 2015– )

23.plot: Deepak Chopra and Bernardo Kastrup, philosopher and author discuss why consciousness could be the fundamental reality of the universe.

24.title: Waking Up to Our Immortal Being

episode of.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (TV Series 2015– )

24.plot: At the fundamental level of existence is death an illusion? Deepak Chopra and philosopher Bernardo Kastrup discuss this and other elemental questions.

25.title: The Living Universe

episode of.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (TV Series 2015– )

25.plot: Are we part of a living universe that evolves, grows and is conscious ? Duane Elgin, noted speaker and author, discusses this and other questions with Deepak Chopra.

26.title: The World of Astrology

episode of.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (TV Series 2015– )

26.plot: Deepak Chopra talks with Susan Miller, astrologer, about the logic behind the study of Astrology.

27.title: The Neuroscience of Consciousness

episode of.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (TV Series 2015– )

27.plot: How do we or can we measure consciousness scientifically? Deepak Chopra talks with Heather Berlin, who focuses her studies on brain-behavior relationships.

28.title: Cosmic Evolution: Current Understanding of the Universe

episode of.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (TV Series 2015– )

28.plot: Astrophysicist Joel Primack discusses our current theories of the universe and its origins with Deepak Chopra.

30.title: What Your Thoughts Cannot Tell You

episode of.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (TV Series 2015– )

30.plot: Deepak Chopra interviews Kleopatra Ormos, psychiatrist and author, about her book, "Journey of the Human Sculptor: What your thoughts cannot tell you".

imdb.title: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra
akas: Curious Minds with Deepak Chopra (United States)
plot: Deepak Chopra talks informally with leading physicists and scientists about their work and the larger questions of humankind's existence.
